website_summaries.verdict: The 7-inch Amazon Kindle Fire HD is a great way to consume your Amazon content on a small screen, but it's not the fastest or most flexible $200 tablet any more.
pros: Amazon Prime members get lots of video and book content
cons: Rigidly locked to the Amazon ecosystem

customer_reviews.title: Daily Use Since 2012!
customer_reviews.text: This Kindle HD 7 was given to me for Christmas in 2012 and I have used it every day since then with not one single problem. I've read books, played games, watched movies and tv series from Amazon and sometimes plugged in an hdmi cord to watch on a larger screen tv. This Kindle feels just the right weight for me. I recently purchased a Kindle Fire 10 but feel my first Kindle will always be my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: MaxMom1

customer_reviews.title: 2020 and it still works every day.
customer_reviews.text: i bought one of these for my girlfriend back in 2014. since then, i have bought a newer tablet, but she also uses this tablet a lot. as we get older, time goes by pretty quick and when i noticed how long she's been using this i was pretty surprised,so i felt like i had to write a review. if you want to buy one used to knock around with, go for it...the battery looks pretty easy to change (imagine that). i asked her if she wanted a new battery for it and she told me that it still works good enough.
customer_reviews.author: cactus

customer_reviews.title: I loved my kindle but lots of problems.
customer_reviews.text: I loved my kindle for about a year but it started slowly dying at that time. I couldn't stream YouTube without the videos getting fuzzy. Adobe was not being compatible with the kindle. The loading time of a internet page to pop up was outrageous it was just get stuck trying to load. The amount of storage was not enough either. I would love to get the newest version of the kindle but I can't justify the money for it to possibly start not working again in a year.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Deutsch

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet
customer_reviews.text: didn't think much of kindle thought it was fad like apple ipad but I was definitely wrong. Ive dropped it but it is still fully functional almost 2years to date. no warranty on like new item. you need to be an avid Amazon eco system since this is not your typical Android system so it has a few restrictions. but Amazon underground is great and lots of free apps equivalent to Google Play store. Small enough to be portable and extremely clear screen but it doesn't work with google chromecast but doesn't surprise me. works with for miracast with amazon fire tv.
customer_reviews.author: Bali38

customer_reviews.title: Defective Battery
customer_reviews.text: Up front, this kindle fire is not the latest. but it shouldn't have to be to work right. it was a gift/back up device that I set aside after set up. all the while, I used a refurbished older model which has a battery that has been very good. (Holds a charge and charges fast. Trouble is, now I am wanting the new reserve fire and the battery is BAD. Defective or very inferior to the other device battery. and Amazon doesn't care much as the warranty passed. It's sort of a 'catch me if ya can' situation. the lesson: don't put anything aside you purchase until you are confident it works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Bo E

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with extended warranty product replacement.
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed that my warranty did not provide a new Kindle but a refurbished one. This Kindle worked great for about two months then started making odd noises, shuts off on its own, and kicks me out of what I was doing with it. And since my previous extended warranty expired is this "refurbished" one covered with a warranty as if it was new????? If so Amazon needs to send me another New one to replace what had been previously covered under a purchased warranty. I have really enjoyed my Kindle's quite a bit and even purchased them for family members. Amazon please make this right.
customer_reviews.author: Diane White

customer_reviews.title: I love my Kindle Fire
customer_reviews.text: My Kindle Fire has held up amazingly well. I've dropped it hundreds of times (in a case and sometimes outside of the case). It's fallen face first on to the ground numerous times and the screen hasn't cracked or scratched and I don't have a screen protector on it! Even though it's old and I replaced it with an iPad I still couldn't let go of my Kindle and use it regularly. If it wasn't for the fact they don't offer many apps for other video services (like VUDU and Hulu) I wouldn't need an iPad.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Powell

customer_reviews.title: Huge software bug beware
customer_reviews.text: I had the first generation kindle and this HD kindle and was happy with both until I discovered a huge software bug. Turns out Amazon gives app developers way too much control on how their apps behave in the Amazon store. So they can update an app and basically make it incompatible with your older kindles. In other words there is a very real chance your apps won't work in the future. I now have many apps that work on my older kindle but won't work with my other kindles. I verified this with Amazon customer support. Looks like this will be my last Kindle...
customer_reviews.author: R. L.

customer_reviews.title: Still Working After 5 years
customer_reviews.text: I would buy the 7" tables over the new 8" tablets they sell now. This device didnt have bloatware and is still working after 5 years of use. Pro: - Fast - Easy to use - Kids Love it - Relevant to this day 1/2019 Con's: - I haven't experienced any i would purchase this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike DeCoste

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: This is not a great product. It sure if it’s because I bought it refurbished ? It constantly shuts off and has since I bought it. Now it won’t even charge. Never was able to watch a movie so Dolby digital sound is a waste .
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great for reading books aloud
customer_reviews.text: This Kindle Fire HD works superbly as a reader. Its big memory stores many audiobooks and Kindle books, and never runs out of memory space like my older Kindles have. Those better speakers are able to overcome background noise better. The pad displays and controls volume better than my older Kindle models. The 'robovoice'-reader for Fire Kindle books pronounces better and seems to make fewer word and name pronunciation mistakes. If you want a Kindle solely for reading books, both audio and print, this Kindle Fire 7 HD will more than satisfy. It's definitely worth paying about 80 more dollars, even if you never intend to watch movies on it.
customer_reviews.author: SF Dev

customer_reviews.title: It was awesome to be able to pack this little thing around ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Kindle Fire Tablet for my deployment to Afghanistan. It was awesome to be able to pack this little thing around while on mission instead of having to pack a laptop like others did. Having the WiFi option to stream Netflix and other items was really convenient and enjoyable. I would definitely recommend a Kindle Fire as it's a cheaper option than an iPad or Microsoft Surface.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. H

customer_reviews.title: Great basic tablet.
customer_reviews.text: Loved it at first, but over the years the short-comings are disappointing. First, let me say that this is a rugged tablet with great audio and video. Battery lasts about 4 hours. The cons: no ability to update apps or OS. I know this because my Samsung phone updates apps all the time, while my tablet never does. There is no expansion slot for storage. In addition, it will not recognize a usb drive to transfer data.
customer_reviews.author: PoorBoy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Device!
customer_reviews.text: I use the kindle fire hd for the following -movies -games -tv shows -reading magazine and book Advantages -Awesome Screen Resolution -Battery Life -Processor Speed -Speakers(about 100 times better then the apple mini tablet) -amazon prime for the shows you missed or Netflix! - huge book and magazine selection Disadvantages -Charging Time is really the only crappy thing everything else is awesome! Final Impression Really impressed with the quality of the build, dexterity and speaker quality, As a daily little companion for coffee or to watch the occasional show you missed out on the night before this is the device to get. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Maximus

customer_reviews.title: So awesome
customer_reviews.text: Everyone needs to buy one of these. I bring it everywhere I go. I barely use my computer anymore. I use it to browse the internet, pay my bills, email, read books, listen to music, and occasionally watch movies on it. I also use it to buy more things on Amazon. The hi-def is amazing - I can't believe what I am looking at. It looks clearer than my HD TV sometimes and I have a Samsung - a great brand! The sound is great too, it really sounds like surround. And for only $199. Cheaper than buying any Mac product and you get just as much - and more!
customer_reviews.author: S. G.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Too many programs on it. Just wanted a reader. Extremely slow to load. Also not very user-friendly. Hard to figure out where things are. Finally, it died in less than 5 years. Will no longer hold a charge. The one I had prior to this lasted much longer
customer_reviews.author: Victoria J LeVitre

customer_reviews.title: Charger port / cord issues
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tablet for almost three years now, and I just wanted to give an updated review. It has been a great tablet. The only problem is with the charging port / cord. It recently stopped charging and the charging port seemed loose. Instead of buying a new tablet, I figured I would try a new power cord first. It solved the problem completely! I have read many reviews about charging issues. This might be something you want to try before trashing the whole tablet.
customer_reviews.author: bristol_mamma

customer_reviews.title: Buyer's remorse
customer_reviews.text: It appeared to be decent in the beginning but after three weeks of use, but the thing just died. It wasn't used everyday. It did give us glimpses of wear throughout the first week when it would shut down on its own. It kept doing it sporadically, so it foreshadowed its short lifespan. We spent $76 on a second hand, which I expected could at least get us to 6 months to a year's worth of use. I'm sure there's good deals out there, but we just stumbled upon one that was not, so be aware of that when you choose to purchase a second hand.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Too Locked Down
customer_reviews.text: Too locked down, making Development hard. Certain apps for development are only available on Google Play. Either Amazon needs to woo people into releasing those apps on their store, or they need to stop locking things down so much and let me install Google Play to get the apps I need to test this device. They are shooting themselves in the foot, as it makes me more likely to just test on some other Android devices and then just hope everything works well on the Kindle. As far as the hardware goes, I'm perfectly happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: my favorite thing
customer_reviews.text: i use it everyday mainly for reading my granddaughter uses it for her games it has been 3 years and for 2 1/2 of these years it's had a charging problem i was even suckered on the faster charger then i got mad and got a galaxy something from sprint hated that thing tried to use it and spent more time downloading things i don't use went back to my trusty fire despite charging issues i am buy a new one for my granddaughter and another for me i also still use my first reader oh and my music is weird so i hardly listen to it anymore
customer_reviews.author: dralyn Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  2nd Kindle... recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Love my Kindle Fire, waited to purchase the Kindle Fire HD so that I can Skype while traveling. It's great! It's much more sensitive than my first Kindle Fire, and I would like to find a vertically standing case for it for ease of reading when I'm on a plane. Overall, the Kindle Fire HD is a great deal, I can download data to my cloud and share it between my devices. I travel 2 weeks/month for work and this is a great device for travel since I have to carry my work laptop. It's compact, but it has everything I need; internet access, streaming videos (excellent viewing with the HD!), music, books, movies, email, web, weather, Skype! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Angejeeper

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular
customer_reviews.text: What can I say--spectacular--and $130 cheaper than the Apple Mini. I love the Kindle HD. The screen is beautiful, the sound is great, and it plays Angy Birds. What else do you need? I bought it mainly for Angry Birds, Hulu, Amazon VOD, and Netflix--oh yea, and books as well. Works great. Sometimes when I just want to curl up in bed, but yet I want to catch up on American Horror Story--now I can do it. Also, I'm the network admin for my company, so I can use Teamviewer to troubleshoot any server problems--right from the same tablet. Definitely one of the best purchases I ever made.
customer_reviews.author: AMK

customer_reviews.title: 32GB Kindle Fire is not worth it; get an Android tablet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few years ago. I wouldn't re-purchase it; I'd buy an Android tablet. I mainly bought this Kindle Fire for the convenience of reading books but I honestly having been reading as much as I planned. MAIN DOWNSIDES: -No Google play -No Android OS (duh!) -Not compatible with most apps -Audio seems to go bad eventually
customer_reviews.author: JTSM

customer_reviews.title: I don't like the reviews on the newer model
customer_reviews.text: Has kept me from spending so much time in front of my computer. Use it every day for Internet. When need an eBook, works very well. Background updates are seamless. When I've had to call with a question, the customer service person has been knowledgeable and patient. Have had for almost 3 years and may have to replace because of the volume button. Hoping not because. I don't like the reviews on the newer model.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The wait was worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough positive things about my Kindle Fire HD. The picture and sound is amazing. It is fast and seamless on the internet. The on-screen keyboard is easy to use and comfortable. I would also like to add, Amazon was great when my first order was lost in shipment. They are uber-attentive and concerned about making things right and getting the shipment corrected (a little overboard in some cases-but that is better than not). Love Amazon, always have and will remain a faithful customer. Now back to Dr. Who on my Kindle Fire HD.
customer_reviews.author: H. Sweany

customer_reviews.title: Kindle Fire is Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I am TOTALLY satisfied with my purchase of the Kindle Fire HD. It is capable of completing several functions and is extremely easy to use. It is light and compact enough for portability anywhere. The screen is large enough to easily view apps, games, web surfing, etc. in both portrait and landscape view. I have not found one thing yet (after almost a month of usage) that could be considered as a negative. This product would be an AWESOME holiday gift for people of all ages. It is very affordable, fun, and practical. You will not be disappointed if you buy one. The only difficulty you may encounter is keeping OTHER people from using your Kindle!!
customer_reviews.author: Lorna M

customer_reviews.title: Glad I choose it over the Ipad
customer_reviews.text: I was torn between purchasing the Ipad and the Fire. After much research on both I bought the Fire HD 7. And I have not regretted it one minute. It will do anything I want it to do and was a heck of alot cheaper. I read, shop, facebook, google, etc. The only things I have found that the IPad is superior to the Kindle Fire on is that it can take pictures and type a doc. I use my iphone for pics anyway and I have my computer for working. All in all I know I made the right choice and my Fire HD was a lot cheaper. Would do it again
customer_reviews.author: Jan Cole

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with refurbished models
customer_reviews.text: Be very careful if buying this device refurbished (which you probably are at this point, as it's an old model). Although the product and order pages indicate a one year warranty, there is no such warranty. It came with a nearly worthless battery but I didn't realize that until I was past the 30 day return date, because it was a gift and the problem wasn't immediately visible from just turning it on to test out. The kindle itself is great and I love Kindle Freetime, but hate that we have to use it plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: LOVE love love
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my kindle, I was running out of space on my bookshelf and this is the best investment I have made. I love that you can also browse the web on this device, however if you do use it to browse or use social media apps on it be sure to go behind and clean out your cookies and data cache, it will slow down the performance if you don't. has a camera and you can buy an app that allows you to film with it too, it is surprisingly high quality video too! Very Happy with this purchase I have recommended to all my friends!
customer_reviews.author: katattack

customer_reviews.title: Not a good idea for long term
customer_reviews.text: worked great for lil over year but now.... freezes up, want charge, if it comes on at all. Did NOT get wet or drop. Called customer service to see about it. First they stated the obvious to hold power button, try to charge. ugh! Why would I call if it were that simple.They said they could NOT Replace for free but they could Sell me a refurbished USED one for $89.00. Really i paid $210. The kindle Fire is supposed to be the best! They want me to buy one that will have more problems! No Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Shahara

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up, great tablet!
customer_reviews.text: I use my kindle all the time. I love it! It's great for school, work, and home life. It isn't the best personal tablet on the market but for the price this is my personal favorite. I love reading on it, you can change the settings to fit your personal preference and I love that the brightness can be adjusted to the perfect setting (the lowest setting isn't too bright either). Searching on the internet with this device is fairly easy. I prefer this kindle with a keyboard attachment for writing notes for school. So, if you're getting this for school or even work, that might be an option you would want to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Abbigail Hunt

customer_reviews.title: MUCH MORE THAN I EXPECTED!
customer_reviews.text: The Kindle Fire is much more than I expected! My husband bought it for Mother's Day and I couldn't be happier. The colors are incredible, the sound is awesome. If you have used a laptop then just imagine putting the HD quality of a new laptop add the sound and stuff it all into a seven inch screen, giving you the advantage of portability. All of the benefits of a laptop, TV, and book in one. I can surf the web, play a games, read a book, watch a movie or my favorite TV programs anytime. My biggest suggestion is make sure you have Wi-Fi in your home.
customer_reviews.author: Donna B

customer_reviews.title: worst service experience I have ever had with KIndle
customer_reviews.text: Kindle did not state that they were sending me a refurbished item when they "offered" an upgrade for my KIndle Tablet with keyboard and 3G which cannot now connect to my e-mail apparently due to, as of now, insurmountable technical problems. Kindle neglected to send the power supply with the refurbished item. There was enough power to turn it on, but the screen was locked and no way to change that. Why they couldn't have taken 20.00 off the current Xmas price of a new device instead of charging 78.00 for a refurbished item is a bit beyond me. In any case I am withdrawing from the KIndle world entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Notzon

customer_reviews.title: This works fine. I only wish Amazon made it easier to ...
customer_reviews.text: This works fine. I only wish Amazon made it easier to find out which generation device I have. I was trying to buy a cover for it, but had to know whether it was a 1st, 2nd or 3rd generation because there are small differences in size and fit, evidently. Even knowing my serial number and searching the internet, including the online Kindle help resources, I was not able to find out that I have a 2nd generation Kindle Fire HD until I got in touch with Amazon and they looked it up in their internal records. I asked the rep where customers could find this information and he said it was only available by contacting Amazon directly.
customer_reviews.author: Books633

customer_reviews.title: I love my kindle
customer_reviews.text: I have become an acolyte in the cult of amazon. The battery life is more than adequate for the time I generally spend away from charger access. I have downloaded (purchased and borrowed) books consistently. I enjoy being able to annotate my professional reading. The games are adequately mindless to keep me entertained when I want to play and the move quality is great. I had a problem with the first HD that I purchased. It would turn on and off by itself. When I finally got around to calling for assistance, Amazon had a new one in my hands within 3 business days.
customer_reviews.author: H.habilis

customer_reviews.title: KindleHD
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Kindle .Was user friendly,lite,easy to take with you. I used it constantly for almost a year,before I could no longer get it to charge,luckily it was still covered under the warranty. Amazon was very helpful and totally replaced it for me without any hassle! I was very pleased with thier service. The only problem I had not saved all my pictures to the cloud. The first few pictures I had taken were only on the drive so I was unable to retrieve to the new kindle. I was able to get back all pictures on the cloud and all the apps and books that I had previously purchased..Amazon took care of the problem immediately. Would definitly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sesor

customer_reviews.title: Video downloads won't complete
customer_reviews.text: Only a few months old, and my Kindle HD's video download is kaput! I spent a couple hours on the phone with very nice techs who unfortunately couldn't solve the problem, even after the drastic process of de-registering the device. So, I'm on hold, waiting for help while they "look in to it." Boo-hoo. I really hope they can "fix" this so I can download some videos for an up-coming trip. I think I might have to stop by the Apple store on the way home from work this week. I've just had too much trouble with my Kindle Fire and HD.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my first edition kindle since the screen was burning out. I wanted something a little smaller than my iPad yet wanted another kindle to be able to borrow books using my prime account. The screen doesn't brighten or darken due to surrounding lights like my iPad does so if you turn it on at night, you're blinded. It really burns through the battery too. With as much as I read, it won't last a week on 1 charge and then charging it takes FOREVER. Even overnight is not long enough. While you can surf on it and download other applications, I doubt I'll use this for anything other than reading books.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Let the Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Totally dissatisfied. My unit, which was purchased in June 2013, went haywire on me today and I couldn't access settings at all. I worked with 3 different techs - no resolution. The third representative offered me to get me a discount on a different unit. I told her that I wasn't too keen on purchasing another if it was going to die 3 months out of warranty (and she admitted that it should have lasted longer) but I still asked what she would offer for a discount. Turns out she was only offering the same discounts I could get by simply logging onto the site. This is not the type of customer service I have come to expect from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Cione

customer_reviews.title: too early to know -- good so far
customer_reviews.text: we have been on the TX-Mex border as gate-guards since I got my *new* kindle. internet access here is terrible. I have been careful to keep it in "airplane mode" as much as possible to *protect* the battery. that is what happened to my first kindle -- the battery died. I recommend to ALL KINDLE USERS keep it in *airplane mode* except when you are actually accessing the internet to protect the life of your battery. I am very happy with the way that all the materials from my first kindle are available to my second kindle. when we have better internet for a while I will be able to say more.
customer_reviews.author: A. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Repair?  Where?
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Kindle Fire 32 for just over two years. Fine machine. Over 100 books to date. One problem now. It no longer shows a wireless icon on the home page. If I swipe the top bar and choose wireless, it locates the nearbt Wi-Fi facilities, my home Wi-fi shows an excellent signal. When I try to connect, it respionds with "authetication failed". Strange, my Kindle Fire HD connects quite normally from the same location. My local guru is unable to work on a Kindle, and recommended I contact Amazon.com. So far I have not found an Amazon.com site that offers assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Wendell L. Gladish

customer_reviews.title: New user to Kindle line of products
customer_reviews.text: Now that I know how to operate my kindle and all the things you can do on it I am extremely pleased. So far I have received/sent email, played games. Looking forward to reading on my Kindle. I haven't had a chance to watch a movie or tv shows on it, but I'm sure it will be a wonderful addition. The sound is very good as well as the pictures on the screen. I origally bought my Kindle to help pass the time on long, boring airplane flights, but I am sure now that I will use it just as often at home.
customer_reviews.author: cmh7611

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!,
customer_reviews.text: First off I would like to say I am a huge apple fan and both my daughters wanted iPad minis for Christmas after waiting around on them forever to come out I started looking at other options. I do 99% of my shopping on amazon and always see the kindles advertised. I read a lot of the reviews and decided to give it a try. This thing does not disappoint. The graphics are incredible compared to my ipad2 and it is definitely faster. My daughters love the amazon library and we have both Netflix and now amazon instant video so we are never without something to watch. The value in this tablet alone is worth buying it over an iPad.
customer_reviews.author: David Jones

customer_reviews.title: I love my Kindle
customer_reviews.text: I love my Kindle! I've had it for four years and it is still working as well as when I first got it! A few months after I got it, the port where the charger plugs in began loose, making it difficult to charge. I contacted Amazon for assistance (I had originally purchased it in a store), and they were able to replace my Kindle for free once the problem was identified. I've haven't had any issues since.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Needs work on the battery
customer_reviews.text: I got it in August. I love it and use it daily almost around the clock. Most of the time it is kept plugged in because the battery charge doesn't last long. I bought a power fast charger, and when I used "power fast charger" the screen message called it a low power charger. The other thing I noticed is after a long usage the Kindle heated up, like the old laptops and netbooks used to do. After talking to the Kindle service people (all overseas), we came to the conclusion it is defective. Yes, they are send a replacement next day. In my opinion, I believe it needs to have a battery which will hold a charge longer,
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Lagamorph

customer_reviews.title: but like I said
customer_reviews.text: My first Kindle died after one year because it would not charge. I called customer service and they sent me a new one immediately - they were kind and helpful - rave reviews for their customer service!!! The second one they sent me says there is no charge left within 15 minutes, but it runs "on red" for about 2.5 hours longer. It also has pop-ups saying it has no charge, but like I said, it runs for about 2 more hours. I have to call customer service again. When they sent the second kindle all of my aps and such immediately downloaded which was a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole M Hall

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed kindle
customer_reviews.text: Had the original kindle fire and loved it until warrantee ran out & the charging port broke. Could not be fixed! called Amazon & rep recommended for $ 100.00& turn in broken one I could have this upgrade . That it would be refurbished isn't the problem. The rep said it also had a camera. What she didn't mention was the camera is backwards, that is, great for taking selfies. but not much else. It is bigger & heavier so won't fit my existing case . Don't know why it needs such a wide frame around the screen. Also on/off & volume buttons are totally hidden .No ease of use here . Poorly designed on the cheap .
customer_reviews.author: concor

customer_reviews.title: Wished I had bought it sooner..
customer_reviews.text: I truly love this thing. My only complaint is that the advertising was a bit misleading on this HUGE free library that Amazon lets you use. They kind of forgot that you can only check out ONE book a month. And that in some cases a "book" is only 42 pages long. So choose your free book of the month carefully... And although there are MILLIONS of books at 99c - many are not BOOKS - they are short stories. True novels cost more. But this is not the Kindle - this is the salemanship that comes with it. The Kindle I love. Just maybe the advertising could have been a little more truthful... or maybe less deceiving...
customer_reviews.author: Michelinda Smith

customer_reviews.title: Certified Refurbished Kindle Fire HD 7", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi
customer_reviews.text: So far, I am loving this device. It is my third Kindle, and my first Kindle Fire HD. I like having the ability to keep up with my book (and change the screen back light from white, sepia and black, plus font size), and switch over to check e-mail or Facebook, or check something on the Web. I have watched one Netflix film so far and the picture was very sharp, and the sound was great. It's an amazing little device, and the only thing I do regret is that the battery doesn't hold it's charge very long, HOWEVER, for all that this device does, I don't mind keeping it plugged into charge every night.
customer_reviews.author: Catheter

customer_reviews.title: My third Kindle
customer_reviews.text: This unit goes far beyond the original Kindle. It has a serviceable web browser and lets one watch movies and videos as well as reading Kindle books. I charge mine at night, and seldom run low on power even on a day filled with heavy use. The only downside, and the one that kept my wife from wanting one, is that it is significantly heavier than other Kindle readers. I access the web on my laptop and phone as well as on this, but the Fire HD has a gorgeous display and works well for most quick web access needs. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Does not support IHeartRadio. -  User interface  clunky
customer_reviews.text: I Returned this item because it does not support iHeartRadio. Customer support was excellent and return was easy so kudos to Amazon for that. My kindle books did show up immediately and all things being equal I would’ve kept this device but it would not do what I needed it to do bought an iPad instead. 2 stars because of Customer service.
customer_reviews.author: M. Harding

customer_reviews.title: Love my Kindle Fire!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Kindle Fire though I had a problem with it right off the bat but the tech's helped me to get it fixed and though I haven't used it a lot so far so good. I have audio books plus books and movies and all has worked ok. I don't hesitate buying refurbished and I give credit to the Tech's who were very helpful!!! I bought it because I had the first Fire which ran out of space!!! Needed to update. An additional thought I forgot my only dislike is when reading a book the pages can flip too fast and I get lost; that's one correction I hope will be updated on newer Fire's.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Kindle Fire  HD  7"- A lot to like!
customer_reviews.text: I have had my 7" HD for about one week now and I couldn't be happier with my purchase. Everything is as good as advertised, or even better. The quality of the video and sound (Dolby stereo on a 7" tablet with great volume, who else offers that?) Is fantastic. Itis easy to set up and use for the non-technical. For those that want to do more, it's easy to download a different browser and flash. This makes it easy to download android apps that are not offered by amazon. It's a great deal for $200. I read a lot about the Fire HD and the Nexus 7 before buying, and am more than happy with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: Itsme

customer_reviews.title: Customer service was very helpful in sending me a new kindle
customer_reviews.text: I had to trade in my first refurbished kindle since it was malfunctioning. To my surprise I had a one year warranty that was still active. I called the kindle support line and after speaking with very helpful staff we determined I did not have an out dated software but a bad device. After a few emails I was sent my new kindle which is also refurbished. It arrived two days after I talked to the support staff. I have been using it constantly to ensure it isn't faulty like my last. I only get a 90 day warranty on this kindle. So far I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: kaytness

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Better than what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I used points to pick up the Kindle HD Fire. Wasn't expecting much, after all, it was a lot cheaper than the IPad or other comparable tablets. I was shocked. The Kindle Fire HD 7" exceeded anything I expected. Much more than just a kindle, it runs apps available from the Amazon store and the battery life is very good. The sound is incredibly clear and I used the Amazon service to stream an HD movie which ran flawlessly on the HD with great sound. The only downside was having to SEPARATELY order the fast charging cord. To me this was the only detriment to an otherwise outstanding product.
customer_reviews.author: John Williams

customer_reviews.title: It is exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting a tablet for home and work use (wi-fi in both places). Pros: Amazon Prime: I love the fact that I can download a movie to my Kindle and play it on my tv using the usb to hdmi cable that I bought. Size: it fits very well in my hand and it not very heavy.. Display/sound: The HD aspect of the Fire is amazing. Crystal clear picture and great sound. Apps: There are alot of great apps. Cons: Apps: Some of the apps that are offered by Amazon for Android do not necessary work for the Fire and that is disappointing. Overall, I am very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: shill822

customer_reviews.title: Best Android-based tablet!
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is truly amazing. However, here's a list of some things you should know before you buy: * sound is very high-quality and perfect! * the Amazon app store does have a Facebook app, but not a messages or pages manager app. * the pictures of this device make it look a little thick. trust me, it's very thin! * the power and volume buttons are a little difficult to locate at first. you'll eventually adapt! * no physical home button. on-screen only. * very light machine.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Love it more then you know...
customer_reviews.text: When Kindle's first came out I was interested but wanted to wait till I saw something which blew me away. The Kindle Fire did just that. The Kindle Fire has countless apps as well as access for videos music and shopping the amazon site wherever you are. The picture is quality is amazing and the sound was much loader then I actually thought it was. I also love the ability to switch to low light reading perfect for night time reading without disturbing the person next to you. The only thing I wish I would have done better was get the 32 gig.
customer_reviews.author: Mama

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should try this
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a 5 star rating because I have a kindle and love it except for having to use a light at night so this makes reading so much more enjoyable when in bed. Then there is the fact that it is basically a handheld computer which makes it so much easier when skyping ( you can wander all over the house and grounds) and its much lighter than expected. The videos are outstanding and game play is quick and responsive. All in all so much cheaper than other brand tablets and more than I could have asked for. I am still new to this and look forward to learning all my kindle fire HD can do! thanks amazon
customer_reviews.author: Southern Dee

customer_reviews.title: Get a refurb at half the price? Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this refurbished for my granddaughter. She lives in another state but now with our devices on the same account, I can get het her books and games instantly. She loves watching the kids videos with my prime account are free. I turned on parental controls for her device only and now she can't accidentally buy stuff. Her mother has to remove stuff from the carousel that I buy for myself but it hasn't seemed to bother them. I know both the parents like that she doesn't have to play on their Ipads. Extremely pleased with my purchase. Refurbished, it still looked like new. Highly recommend the sleep wake cover to save on.battery when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife, who had a regular Kindle Fire, and she has been extremely happy with it. She wouldn't go back to the regular Kindle for anything. She carries the Kindle HD everywhere and constantly praises its features -- except the oddity of the screen being upside down for the carrying case -- if you open the carrying case like a book. The screen display can be flipped, using the internal software, but it is odd that the carrier has to be opened like you are opening the BACK of a book for the screen to be right side up. Overall, a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Lefty

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 12-year-old daughter. I am a confirmed iPad user, so i was not convinced that the Kindle would be acceptable. I also had previously owned a nook Tablet, and returned it after one week, since the number of apps was so limited (and so expensive). My daughter loves the Kindle. She is actively reading books on the device that she struggled with in hard copy format. The ability to change the size of the text and to read in the dark are big benefits for her. I am very pleased with the results. Still wish there were more apps, and that they did not mostly cost $3.
customer_reviews.author: Bronco

customer_reviews.title: Shocked and Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for my Kindle Fire that started having lock up issues and power on & off problems. The Kindle I originally bought was a brand new unit but Amazon sent a refurbished one to replace it. If I had purchased a refurbed one at a refurb price I could accept a refurbed replacement, but I paid full price for a new one. Now I feel like I'm getting someone else's problem. I guess I'll just have to keep my fingers crossed, but I will think long and hard before purchasing any tech device with Amazon's name on it..
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I expected
customer_reviews.text: But not bad. I wanted something I could read outside with no reflection, and although this is better than my non HD Kindle, there is some reflection, but I can sit outside and read with it whereas the old one was totally impossible to see. Also I was disappointed that there is no external charge indicator when charging... and the onboard one is hard to read. It also is hard to find the power button, it's so flush to the case that it's just lost. The ads on the start screen are ugly, but... Having said all that, I would add that I am not sorry I ordered it. The camera works well, and the other functions work as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Schuman

customer_reviews.title: Customer service: "too bad, buy a new one"
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. I've had 4 kindles, and they are not worth it. I justified these purchases thinking Amazon has great customer service. And yes, as they broke, Amazon replaced them. Very poor design. The charging port for these easily breaks rendering these useless. I have a gen 1 iPad that still works like the day I bought it. I've had three of these kindle fires break and now I'm told even though there is an inherent design flaw I should spend hundreds on a replacement. The warranty is only good from the date of original purchase. My justification for these kindles was inherently flawed. Customer service can't replace an overpriced piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Lo

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Product
customer_reviews.text: I mostly read ebooks on my Fire HD, but enjoy having the flexibility to check my email or surf the net on the same device. My other 2 Kindles may be going to family members so this will likely be my main reading device. Right now I read from all 3. Also have an iPad but didn't like using it as my main ereader. Enjoy the crispness of the Fire HD screen. I have an m edge cover for it, but think I will buy a sleeve. Prefer holding it without the extra weight of the cover. I've always been pleased with Amazon products and,so far, am enjoying the Fire HD. Looking for more apps in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Nurse

customer_reviews.title: I'm adicted to my kindle
customer_reviews.text: Kindle Kindle Kindle, do I need to say more. I got my Kindle fire in 2011. I loved it. 5 stars, so this year for Xmas I did buy this kindle for my wife. It is different and I personally like my older one better. the on off button, the response to the touch screen. But my wife never used mine and loves this one. again I love the Kindle. I have an Ipad and I'll take my kindle any time. C.Flemish feel free to discuss this with me at @wookie198 [...] and if you are in the mood for something good to read feel free to check out one of my own books. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: C. Flemish

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant, intuitive, and sounds amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I am so thrilled with my purchase of the Kindle Fire HD... that I pre-ordered the 8.9 inch and when that arrives will give this 7" to a family member so they can enjoy. this is the best tool ever. I've had an android phone and was thrilled when I discovered the power of android.. this is android magnified in terms of what can be done. the video and screen colors are vibrant, the sound is better than my tv!, and very very functional. I recommend! Only reason I downgraded to 4 stars is because can't do attachments with gmail. ....at least I haven't figured out how yet.
customer_reviews.author: PFK Florida

customer_reviews.title: On Fire With the HD Fire
customer_reviews.text: I'v had this little guy just over 2 weeks. I love it. It has replaced my laptop as my preferred internet device. I would give it a 5 but the browser has some minor problems with some specific web pages I frequent. Amazon support has been terrific. I thought I had a problem with Skype. Amazon was helpful through chat and direct telephone. We found that I had no problem with my Windows PC and Skype. My wife's IPAD will not accept video from my Fire HD. Audio to her is fine and the Fire HD accepts her video and audio. Amazon's support was also very fast in responding to me. I rated their support 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: RAW

customer_reviews.title: just what i wanted
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Kindle Fire for about two weeks now and I love it! I read all the time and I find it much easier to read than any other tablet I have tried. I didnt think I would use it much for movies or TV but boy was I wrong! The HD is crisp and clean, the sound just right for 1 person viewing and listening. Did not want to spend the money on an Ipad, glad I didnt. Two of my friends have Ipads and after playing around with my Kindle Fire, they want their money back!! lol.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, for exactly one year
customer_reviews.text: I loved this thing for the year it worked. FreeTime is great if you have small children. The HDMI out is a nice feature too. Then -- less than a week after the one year warranty expired -- it started turning off on its own despite being charged. Sometimes it powers off before it finishes powering on. It doesn't stay on long enough to be usable at all. And it doesn't appear to be the result of a faulty or damaged power switch. I am not an Apple fan at all, but I must admit we have two iPads (including a first gen) that are still going strong and have never had any issues. I can't recommend refurbished Kindle products.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: In all respects, this is a wonderful product that anyone can successfully use. It is backed up by excellent support services. It has step by step directions for its operation and any possible problems. I only wish that it had a memo recommending and showing how to access this info. I came upon this data quite by accident. I could have saved time and had an easier orientation with an info insert positioned atop the Kindle. The new HDX sounds great with especially the addition of a front-facing camera and instant communication with product assistance technicians. I always feel that Amazon is a company with integrity that has its customers uppermost in its operations.
customer_reviews.author: rammann8341

customer_reviews.title: The Best Electronics Purchase I've made in Years
customer_reviews.text: This is truly the best electronics purchase I've made in years. I LOVE this tablet. This is perfect for the things I need/want most in a tablet - email, reading books, reading magazines, surfing the web, watching videos/movies. It is lightweight, easy to see/use (intuitive and logical formats and usability), responsive touch-screen, good backlighting, incredibly clear everything (the HD is worth the extra money), great sound quality, portability, wi-fi connectivity, and many other features that, for me, are secondary, but great features. I am discovering something new every day. I have no complaints about this tablet. I would recommend the Kindle line, especially the Kindle Fire HD 7" to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: akapoison

customer_reviews.title: I had this device for just a little over two ...
customer_reviews.text: I had this device for just a little over two years and now it has a frozen screen that will only show "Kindle Fire" on it; it won't boot up. Several calls to technical support have yielded help but they have absolutely no clue as to how to fix it. Their only solution is to offer me a nominal credit of $30 (I have invested $338 in this device along with the accessories that go with it). Very disheartened to say the least and will probably not purchase another Kindle. The problem I experienced is common among Kindle users and one would think that Amazon would work on a solution for this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Fran  Razmus

customer_reviews.title: Kudos to the brilliant designers and engineers at Amazon for such a truly ...
customer_reviews.text: Still use it today! Kudos to the brilliant designers and engineers at Amazon for such a truly lovely and revolutionary product. Just need to figure out how to make my battery well again :(.
customer_reviews.author: Conner Dyer
